description.value: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is resistant to the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, and stunned conditions, and it has advantage on saves against spells or effects that would alter its form.
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can breathe air and water.
If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

The aboleth makes three Tentacle or Psychic Bolt attacks. If two Tentacle attacks hit one target, the target must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or contract the slime pox disease (see the Slime Pox trait).
If a creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see communicates telepathically with the [[lookup @name lowercase]], the [[lookup @name lowercase]] learns the creature’s greatest desires.

Characterized by the slimy pustules that erupt across the victim’s body, slime pox is a disease that infects creatures attacked by an [[lookup @name lowercase]] or that come into contact with an [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s slime.

Until the disease is cured, the infected creature can breathe air and water, can’t regain HP except when underwater, and takes [[/damage 1d12 acid average]] damage for every 1 hour it remains outside of water or without moisture applied to its skin.

Every 24 hours that elapse, the infected creature must make a [[/save charisma 16 format=long]]. Each time a creature fails this save, it views the infecting [[lookup @name lowercase]] more and more favorably, becoming the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s doting and protective thrall after three failed saves. The successes and failures don’t need to be consecutive, but once a creature has acquired three of a kind, it no longer has to make this save, resulting in either the creature becoming a thrall of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] or an autonomous—though infected—creature.

Slime pox can be cured only by the @UUID[Compendium.black-flag.spells.Item.46Yd7ExOTYuRanOs]{heal} spell or similar magic.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is coated in an otherworldly mucus. A creature that touches the [[lookup @name lowercase]] or that hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be infected with slime pox (see the Slime Pox trait).
Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]], reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 3d6 + 5 bludgeoning average]] damage.
Ranged Spell Attack: [[/attack]], range 120 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 3d6 + 4 psychic average]] damage.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] floods the minds of up to three creatures it can see within 60 feet of it with random and horrific memories from its eons-long life. Each target must make a [[/save format=long]]. On a failure, a creature takes [[/damage average]] damage and is &Reference[incapacitated]{incapacitated} until the end of its next turn, as its mind reels from the torrent of images, thoughts, and memories. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t incapacitated.
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] automatically detects every creature and trap within 30 feet of it, pinpointing the current location of each.
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] swims up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

affects.special: Creature must be infected with Slime Pox

description.value:
One creature infected with slime pox within 30 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes [[/damage 3d6 acid average]] damage, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains HP equal to the damage the creature takes.

Note: Damage must be rolled from the inline roll above.
